item.title: Amber add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Waiting is painful. Forgetting is painful. But not knowing which to do is the worst kind of suffering." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "You need to learn how to select your thoughts just the same way you select your clothes every day. This is a power you can cultivate. If you want to control things in your life so bad, work on the mind. That's the only thing you should be trying to control." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Amber add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "Hungry man, reach for the book: it is a weapon." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Amber add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "It's so hard to forget pain, but it's even harder to remember sweetness. We have no scar to show for happiness. We learn so little from peace." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Amber add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Amber add a quote by Ryunosuke Akutagawa
item.description: "A man sometimes devotes his life to a desire which he is not sure will ever be fulfilled. Those who laugh at this folly are, after all, no more than mere spectators of life." -- Ryunosuke Akutagawa

item.title: Amber add a quote by Elizabeth Taylor
item.description: "The problem with people who have no vices is that generally you can be pretty sure they're going to have some pretty annoying virtues." -- Elizabeth Taylor

item.title: Amber add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Amber add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Amber add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "It is very risky. But each time a child opens a book, he pushes open the gate that separates him from Elsewhere." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Amber add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Amber add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Amber add a quote by Shauna Niequist
item.description: "It's not hard to decide what you want your life to be about. What's hard, she said, is figuring out what you're willing to give up in order to do the things you really care about." -- Shauna Niequist
